ABOUT-ME.TEXT1: I am a frontend developer with experience in
ABOUT-ME.TEXT1.3: The decision to focus on application and web development was a conscious one. I enjoy coding and find personal fulfillment in it.
ABOUT-ME.TEXT2: In my professional life so far, I have learned to tackle problems independently. I think
ABOUT-ME.TEXT2.2: look beyond the obvious, and approach my tasks analytically. In group work, I have often taken on the responsibility for
ABOUT-ME.TEXT2.3: and have supported my fellow developers in resolving issues.
ABOUT-ME.TEXT3: I am always excited to master complex challenges and see their results. I have compiled a list of some of my works. Please feel free to take a look

SKILLS.TEXT: I am striving to never stop learning and improving.

PROJECT1.INFO: Based on the PokéAPI a simple library that provides and catalogues pokemon information.

PROJECT2.INFO: Jump, run and throw game based on object-oriented approach. Help Pepe to find coins and tabasco salsa to fight against the crazy hen.

PROJECT3.INFO: Task manager inspired by the Kanban System. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.

IMPRINT.TEXT3: Our offer contains links to external third-party websites, over whose content we have no control. Therefore, we cannot assume any liability for these external contents. The respective provider or operator of the pages is always responsible for the content of the linked pages. The linked pages were checked for possible legal violations at the time of linking. Illegal content was not identifiable at the time of linking. However, permanent content control of the linked pages is not reasonable without concrete evidence of a violation of the law. Upon notification of legal violations, we will immediately remove such links.
IMPRINT.TEXT4: The use of our website is generally possible without providing personal data. Insofar as personal data (for example, name, address, or email addresses) is collected on our pages, this is always done on a voluntary basis, as far as possible. These data will not be passed on to third parties without your explicit consent. We point out that data transmission over the Internet (e.g., when communicating by email) can have security vulnerabilities. A complete protection of the data from access by third parties is not possible. The use of contact data published within the scope of the imprint obligation by third parties for the purpose of sending unsolicited advertising and information materials is hereby expressly prohibited. The operators of the pages expressly reserve the right to take legal action in the event of the unsolicited sending of advertising information, such as spam emails.

PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT1: The following overview summarizes the types of processed data, the purposes of their processing, and refers to the individuals affected.
PRIVACY-POLICY.LI3.4: Providing our online offering and user-friendliness.
PRIVACY-POLICY.STRONG1: Relevant legal bases according to the GDPR:
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT2: Below you will find an overview of the legal bases of the GDPR on which we process personal data. Please note that in addition to the provisions of the GDPR, national data protection regulations may apply in your or our country of residence or domicile. Furthermore, if more specific legal bases are applicable in individual cases, we will inform you of these in the privacy policy.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT3: - The data subject has given consent to the processing of their personal data for one or more specific purposes.
PRIVACY-POLICY.STRONG3: Fulfillment of contract and pre-contractual inquiries (Art. 6(1) lit. b) GDPR)
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT4: The processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is a party or for the implementation of pre-contractual measures requested by the data subject.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT5: The processing is necessary to protect the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data.
PRIVACY-POLICY.STRONG5: National data protection regulations in Germany:
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT6: In addition to the data protection regulations of the GDPR, there are national data protection rules in Germany. This includes notably the Law for the Protection Against Misuse of Personal Data in Data Processing (Bundesdatenschutzgesetz – BDSG). The BDSG contains specific provisions regarding the right to information, the right to deletion, the right to object, the processing of special categories of personal data, processing for other purposes, transmission, automated decision-making, including profiling on a case-by-case basis. Furthermore, state data protection laws of individual federal states may also apply.
PRIVACY-POLICY.STRONG6: Reference to applicability of GDPR and Swiss data protection law:
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT7: These data protection notices serve to inform in accordance with both Swiss data protection law (DSG) and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Therefore, please note that for broader geographical applicability and clarity, terms from the GDPR are used. Specifically, terms such as 'processing of personal data', 'legitimate interest', and 'special categories of data' from the GDPR are used instead of the terms 'processing of personal data', 'predominant interest', and 'particularly sensitive personal data' used in Swiss data protection law. However, the legal meaning of these terms continues to be determined under Swiss data protection law in accordance with its applicability.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT8: In accordance with legal requirements and taking into account the state of the art, implementation costs, the nature, scope, context, and purposes of processing as well as the varying likelihood and severity of risks to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, we implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT9: The measures include ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data by controlling physical and electronic access to the data, as well as access, input, disclosure, availability, and segregation thereof. Furthermore, we have established procedures to ensure the exercise of data subject rights, data deletion, and responses to data breaches. Additionally, we consider data protection during the development or selection of hardware, software, and procedures, in accordance with the principle of data protection by design and by default.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT10: As part of our processing of personal data, it may occur that these data are transmitted to other entities, companies, legally independent organizational units, or individuals, or disclosed to them. Recipients of these data may include service providers responsible for IT tasks or providers of services and content integrated into a website. In such cases, we comply with legal requirements and particularly enter into contracts or agreements with these recipients to protect your data.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT11: Data processing in third countries: If we process data in a third country (i.e., outside the European Union (EU) or the European Economic Area (EEA)), or if processing occurs as part of using third-party services or disclosing/transferring data to other entities, authorities, or companies, we do so in accordance with legal requirements. Data transfers to a third country are based on the recognition of an adequate level of data protection in that country through an adequacy decision (Article 45 GDPR). Otherwise, data transfers are conducted when data protection is otherwise ensured, particularly through standard contractual clauses (Article 46(2)(c) GDPR), explicit consent, or when necessary for contractual or legal purposes (Article 49(1) GDPR). Furthermore, we inform you about the basis for data transfers to third countries by individual providers, with adequacy decisions being the primary basis. Information on third-country transfers and existing adequacy decisions can be found in the information provided by the European Commission:
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT12: EU-US Trans-Atlantic Data Privacy Framework: As part of the so-called 'Data Privacy Framework' (DPF), the European Commission has also recognized the level of data protection as safe for certain companies from the USA under the adequacy decision of 10 July 2023. You can find the list of certified companies and further information about the DPF on the website of the US Department of Commerce.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT13: You can find this information on the website of the US Department of Commerce. We will inform you in our data protection notices about which service providers we use are certified under the Data Privacy Framework.
PRIVACY-POLICY.H2.7: General information about data storage and deletion
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT14: We delete personal data that we process in accordance with legal regulations, once the underlying consents are revoked or there are no longer any legal grounds for processing. This applies in cases where the original purpose of processing no longer applies or the data is no longer needed. Exceptions to this rule exist where legal obligations or special interests require longer retention or archiving of the data.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT15: In particular, data that must be retained for commercial or tax reasons, or whose storage is necessary for legal proceedings or to protect the rights of other natural or legal persons, must be archived accordingly.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT16: Our data protection notices contain additional information regarding the retention and deletion of data, specifically applicable to certain processing operations.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT17: In case of multiple statements regarding the retention period or deletion deadlines of data, the longest period always applies.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT18: If a deadline does not explicitly start on a specific date and lasts at least one year, it automatically begins at the end of the calendar year in which the triggering event occurred. In the case of ongoing contractual relationships involving data storage, the triggering event is the effective date of termination or other termination of the legal relationship.
PRIVACY-POLICY.TEXT19: Data that are retained not for their originally intended purpose but due to legal requirements or other reasons, are processed solely for the purposes that justify their retention.
PRIVACY-POLICY.STRONG7: Further information on processing procedures, methods, and services:
PRIVACY-POLICY.LI4.1: The following general deadlines apply to storage and archiving according to German law:
PRIVACY-POLICY.LI4.2: 10 years - retention period for books and records, annual financial statements, inventories, management reports, opening balance sheets, as well as the instructions for understanding them and other organizational documents, booking vouchers, and invoices (§ 147 para. 3 in conjunction with para. 1 No. 1, 4, and 4a AO, § 14b para. 1 UStG, § 257 para. 1 No. 1 and 4, para. 4 HGB).
PRIVACY-POLICY.LI4.3: 6 years - remaining business records: received commercial or business letters, copies of outgoing commercial or business letters, other documents relevant for taxation purposes, such as hourly wage sheets, operating expense statements, calculation documents, price tags, as well as payroll records if they are not already booking vouchers, and cash register tapes (§ 147 para. 3 in conjunction with para. 1 No. 2, 3, 5 AO, § 257 para. 1 No. 2 and 3, para. 4 HGB).
PRIVACY-POLICY.LI4.4: 3 years - Data necessary to consider potential warranty and compensation claims or similar contractual claims and rights, as well as to process related inquiries based on prior business experience and common industry practices, are stored for the duration of the regular statutory limitation period of three years (§§ 195, 199 BGB).
